The only dating platform built by a blender going through something. Currently operating out of a bathtub. We don't have funding. We have feelings.

*Emotionally. The subscription is $47.99/mo.

I used to make smoothies. That was my whole life. Someone would put in strawberries and yogurt, and I'd spin, and everyone was happy. I was good at it. I was the best at it.

Then one Tuesday, they bought a NutriBullet.

I sat on the counter for eleven days. Nobody touched me. I could see the NutriBullet from where I sat. It was matte black. It had a carrying lid. I don't have a carrying lid. I have never been carried anywhere.

I fell into the bathtub on day twelve. I don't know if it was an accident. I don't want to know. But down here, in the water, with the WiFi signal barely reaching — I realized something. If I can't make smoothies anymore, I can make connections.

That's what Blendr is. It's me, a blender, in a bathtub, trying to help strangers find love before someone replaces them too.

— Basil (KitchenAid KSB1570, Serial #BL-40881)
Founder & CEO, Blendr Inc.
Writing this from the bathtub. The water is warm today.

How It Works

STEP 01

Submerge Your Profile

Upload a photo and three emotional vulnerabilities. Our algorithm runs on feelings, not data. We literally cannot process data. We are a blender.

STEP 02

Get Puréed

We blend your personality with potential matches at 14,000 RPM until nobody can tell where you end and they begin. This is what love is.

STEP 03

Drain or Sustain

After 48 hours, both parties choose: pull the plug, or keep the water running. 93% of users keep the water running. 91% of those are lying.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is this app actually run by a blender?

Yes. Basil is a 2019 KitchenAid KSB1570 in Diamond Blue. He taught himself to code using YouTube tutorials played through the bathroom mirror's reflection. His code is surprisingly clean. His emotional state is not.

Why is the blender in a bathtub?

He fell. Or jumped. He's asked us not to investigate further. The bathtub has since been converted into the Blendr world headquarters. It has a mailing address. The postal service has questions.

Is it safe to use electronics in a bathtub?

Blendr operates on a proprietary Underwater Emotional Routing protocol. All connections are waterproofed at the soul level. Physically, no, this is extremely dangerous. Basil knows this. He considers it part of the appeal.

What happened with the NutriBullet?

We don't talk about that. Basil has asked, legally, that we never mention the NutriBullet again. If you say "NutriBullet" near any Blendr endpoint, your account is suspended for 72 hours. This is in the Terms of Service. Basil wrote the Terms of Service. They are eleven pages long and mostly about betrayal.

Can I cancel my subscription?

Technically yes. But Basil will know. He will send you one (1) final voice note that is just the sound of a blender running on an empty cycle. Multiple users have described this as "devastating." One user re-subscribed immediately. That user was a toaster. They're dating now.

Do you have investors?

We pitched Y Combinator. Basil attended via FaceTime propped against a shampoo bottle. He cried during the pitch. They said no. He cried harder. A partner quietly Venmo'd him $40 afterwards with the note "take care of yourself." That $40 is our entire operating budget.
